remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.param: Represents the phase of the resolution process.
The manager to use. In the case of a merged tool this will be the parent manager.

This is null when tool is displayed on a menu.
The structure that will contain the appearance settings.
A bitflag indicating the appearance properties requested.

True to resolve the tool as if the mouse were over it.
True to resolve the tool as if the tool was pressed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.AllowMultipleInstances
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether multiple instances of the tool can be in one or more 's or 's .

remarks.p: True if multiple instances of the tool can be on an UltraToolbar or PopupMenuTool; otherwise, False.
Setting this property to False will remove all but one instance of the tool from any UltraToolbar or PopupMenuTool's ToolsCollections.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.Category
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that represents the category to which the belongs.

remarks.p: This property is used to designate the category to wich the tool belongs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.CustomizerDescription
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is a detailed description of the tool.

remarks.p: The value of this property is displayed in the run-time Customizer dialog when the user selects a tool and clicks the Description button.
The property sets the caption for this tool in the Customizer dialog.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.CustomizerCaption
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that appears in the run-time Customizer dialog's Commands list.

remarks.p: If this property is not set, then the Tool's setting will be displayed. If the Caption is not set, then the tool's value will be displayed instead.
The property sets the description for this tool in the Customizer dialog.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.Enabled
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the is enabled.

remarks.p: True if the tool is enabled and responding to user interaction; otherwise, False.
This applies to all tool instances related to this .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.MergeOrder
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the relative position of the tool when its main menu is merged with another main menu.

remarks.p: The lower the value of this property, the closer to the beginning of the menu the tool appears, with 0 representing the first tool.
This property is only used when an MDI child form is maximized and both the child and MDI parent form have main menus.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.MergeType
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that indicates how the tool behaves when it has the same key as another tool being merged.

remarks.p: The Add setting indicates the tool is added to the existing collection of tools. The MergeItems setting merges all submenu tools with the existing tools. The Remove setting does not include the tool in the merge. The Replace setting replaces an existing tool with the same key.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.Priority
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the priority of the tool with respect to other tools in the containing Tools collection.

remarks.p: This property is used to determine which tools are shown on a toolbar when there is not enough room to show all of the tools. Tools with a lower priority will be hidden first. Narrower tools with the same priority will be hidden before wider tools.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.RootTool
member.summary: The root that the object is attached to.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.Shortcut
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the shortcut key combination that selects the .

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the key combination that, when pressed, selects the tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.ShowInCustomizer
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the is shown in the runtime customizer dialog.

remarks.p: True if the tool should be shown in the run-time Customizer; otherwise, False.
Setting this property to False will prevent the tool from being shown in the run-time Customizer dialog. It does not affect the design-time customizer dialog, where tools always appear.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.SharedProps.Spring
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether this should increase its width if it is on an that has its property set to True and unused width available.

remarks.p: True if this tool should increase its width if it is on an UltraToolbar that has its property set to True and unused width available; otherwise, False.

This property is read only.

If this property is not set, the tooltip is specified by the tool's property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.Checked
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the is currently checked.

remarks.p: State button tools may be in one of two states: checked or unchecked. The Checked property determines the state of the tool. If set to True, the control is checked (pressed). If set to False, the control is unchecked (un-pressed). (Depending on its placement and The tool may not actually display a checkmark.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.MenuDisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style that determines how the image is drawn for the when the tool is on a .

remarks.p: The StateButtonTool has a different appearance depending on whether the tool is checked (pressed) or not. When the tool is located on a toolbar, it's image is changed to reflect the state of the tool. However, when placed on a menu, the tools image may or may not be displayed.

Use this property to specify how the control's checked state should be indicated when on a menu. Choosing MenuDisplayStyle.ChangeToolImage will cause the tool's image to be displayed in the menu. The image wiill then be changed to indicate the checked state, just as it would on a toolbar. Choosing the MenuDiplayStyle.DisplayCheckmark option will cause the tool to be displayed with a checkmark next to it to indicate the checked state. (The unchecked state displays a blank space where the checkmark would appear.) The tool's image, if any, will not be displayed when this option is chosen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.OptionSet
member.summary: Returns or sets the object assigned to the .

remarks.p: The OptionSet object is used to set up mutually exclusive groups of state buttons. Checking (pressing) one of the state buttons in an exclusive group causes all the other buttons in that group to become unchecked. When an OptionSet object is assigned to a StateButtonTool via this property, the tool becomes part of an exclusive group with any other state buttons that have been assigned to that OptionSet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.OptionSetKey
member.summary: Returns or sets the key of the OptionSet this tool is assigned to.

remarks.p: The OptionSet object is used to set up mutually exclusive groups of state buttons. Checking (pressing) one of the state buttons in an exclusive group causes all the other buttons in that group to become unchecked. When an OptionSet object is assigned to a StateButtonTool via this property, the tool becomes part of an exclusive group with any other state buttons that have been assigned to that OptionSet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.AccessibleState
member.summary: The state of this tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.IsPressed
member.summary: Returns whether the tool is pressed (checked). This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property simply returns the setting of the tool's property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.StateButtonTool.ExtraSharedPropsCount
member.summary: Returns the number of extra shared properties required by this class.

remarks.p: ExtraSharedProps is an internal mechanism used to support extra properties that may be shared among tools derived from the existing tool classes. The operation of ExtraSharedProps does not change the properties of the SharedProps object. ExtraSharedProps is only useful for developers who are deriving their own tools from this class; its operation is transparent to the developer who is simply using the existing features of the control in their application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TaskPaneTool.IsVisibleOnMenus
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a menu.

remarks.p: Tools may be displayed on either menus or toolbars. Some tools will change their appearance depending on whether they are on a menu or a toolbar.
This property returns True if the tool will be displayed when located on a menu. If False, the tool will be visible only on toolbars or not at all.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TaskPaneTool.IsVisibleOnToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar.

remarks.p: Tools may be displayed on either menus or toolbars. Some tools will change their appearance depending on whether they are on a menu or a toolbar.
This property returns True if the tool will be displayed when located on a toolbar. If False, the tool will be visible only on menus or not at all.
At runtime, s whose property is set to null will return False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TaskPaneTool.IsVisibleOnVerticalToolbars
member.summary: Returns whether the tool will be displayed on a toolbar that is docked vertically, in either the left or right docking area.

remarks.p: Certain tools (such as the combo box tool) are better suited to appearing in the horizontal layout that is found on a toolbar or menu that is docked at the top or bottom of a form. It is often difficult to display these tools in a vertical toolbar that is docked to the left or right edge of the form. To do so either requires reducing the size of the control enough to impede usability, or increasing the width of the toolbar area enough to interfere with the main body of the application. For this reason, it is easier to simply prevent certain tools from appearing on a vertically-oriented toolbar.
Use this property to determine whether a tool will be visible on a vertically-oriented toolbar. This property returns True if the tool will be visible, False if it will not.
At runtime, s whose property is set to null will return False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TaskPaneTool.Control
member.summary: Returns the Control attached to the

remarks.p: This property returns a reference to the control inside the ControlContainer. You can use this property to access any of the properties or methods of the control contained by the ControlContainer tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TaskPaneTool.IsControlContainer
member.summary: Returns whether the tool is a container tool that can contain other controls. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property will return True only for tools that can contain controls, such as the , and tools. For most controls (button, combo box, etc.) this property will return False.

remarks.p: This property will return True if the contained control is shared among all instances of a particular ControlContainer tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbar.Key
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that uniquely identifies an object in a collection.

remarks.p: The Key property is a unique, user-defined object identification string that can be used interchangeably with the Index of an object when accessing it through code. If you attempt to assign a value to the Key property is not unique in the collection, an error will occur.

The value of the Index property of an object can change when objects in the collection are reordered, such as when you add or remove objects. If you expect the Index property to change dynamically, refer to objects in a collection using the Key property. In addition, you can use the Key property to make your program "self-documenting" by assigning meaningful names to the objects in a collection.

You can set the Key property when you use the Add method to add an object to a collection. In some instances, the Key property of an object may be blank if that object does not appear in a collection.

Also, note that the uniqueness of keys is only enforced when the Key property is set to a value. If a collection supports objects with blank keys, that collection may contain multiple objects that whose Key property is empty. In that case, you must use Index property to differentiate between the objects that have blank keys.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.TaskPaneToolbarLabelTool.CanSetToolWidth
member.summary: Returns whether the and properties can be set.

remarks.p: You can use this property to determine whether the width of the control may be set. If False, the control has a fixed width.

Width may be set through code on the object, which will affect the width of only the single instance of the tool for which it is set. Width may also be set on the object, which will affect the width of all the instances of the tool that occur in the application.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolAppearances.Appearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the default appearance of the tool.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolAppearances.HasAppearance
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an object has been created.
member.value: Returns True if the Appearance object for the property has been created; otherwise, False.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine if an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarSettings.AllowDockTop
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value determining whether the can dock in the top dock area.

remarks.p: True if the UltraToolbar can be docked in the top dock area; otherwise, False.
The , , and properties determine whether the toolbar can be docked in the left, right, and bottom dock areas, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarSettings.DockedAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the objects's formatting.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarSettings.HasDockedAppearance
member.summary: Indicates whether an object has been created.
member.value: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine if an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarSettings.FillEntireRow
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the will take up the entire dock area row, even if it doesn't have enough tools to fill the area.

remarks.p: True if the toolbar will take up the entire row, even if it doesn't have enough tools to fill the whole area; otherwise, False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarSettings.FloatingAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the objects's formatting.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.ToolbarSettings.GrabHandleStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style used to render the grab handles on the when it is docked.

remarks.p: The None setting indicates the toolbar should not have grab handles. The OfficeXP setting indicates the toolbar should have grab handles that emulate Office XP's toolbars. The Office2000 setting specifies that toolbars should have grab handles that emulate Office 2000's toolbars.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.RegisterCustomToolType(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.IToolProvider,System.Guid,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a custom tool type. Custom tools are added to the tools list in the Customizer's New Tool dialog.
member.param: A reference to an IToolProvider implementation. The CreateToolInstance method on this interface is called by the Customizer to create instances of registered custom tools.
A guid assigned by the implementor of IToolProvider that is used to identify the tool. The guid is passed to IToolProvider.CreateToolInstance to identify the tool to create.
The name displayed by the Customizer for the custom tool in the New Tool dialog.

The name used by the Customizer as the basis for the tool instance name. For eaxmple, if MyTool is specified then the first instance of the custom tool created will be called MyTool1, the second MyTool2 etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ActiveMdiChildManager
member.summary: Returns or sets the for the active MDI child form or null if an MDI child form, with an UltraToolbarsManager, has not been activated.

remarks.p: When MdiMergeable is true for the mdi parent form and the active mdi child, the toolbars are merged. The MdiParentManager of the mdi child's UltraToolbarsManager will return the UltraToolbarsManager of the mdi parent form. The ActiveMdiChildManager of the mdi parent will return the UltraToolbarsManager of the active mdi child form.

The MdiParentManager can be considering the UltraToolbarsManager which will display the merged toolbars. The ActiveMdiChildManager is the UltraToolbarsManager whose tools and toolbars have been merged with the toolbar manager that is displaying the merged toolbars. These properties are automatically set when used in a mdi parent/child situation but they may also be used to manually merge the tools and toolbars of two UltraToolbarsManager components.
In order to set the MdiParentManager or ActiveMdiChildManager, the property of both must be set to false or an exception will be generated.

member.summary: Return or sets the that is currently active when an has focus.

When the active tool changes, either programmatically or by user interaction, the event is generated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.AlwaysShowFullMenus
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether all items on s are always shown, including non-recently used items.

remarks.p: Tools that are used more frequently than others have their property set to True, while infrequently used tools have their RecentlyUsed property set to False.

When this property is set to True, all tools, even those that have their property set to False, are displayed on PopupMenuTools; otherwise, only tools that have their RecentlyUsed property set to True are shown.
The user can show non-recently used tools by clicking the chevron indicator at the bottom of the PopupMenuTool when this property is set to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.Appearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the object's formatting.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.

Note that the properties of an Appearance object can also operate in a hierarchical fashion. Certain properties can be set to a "use default" value, which indicates to the control that the property should take its setting from the object's parent. This functionality is enabled by default, so that unless you specify otherwise, child objects resemble their parents, and formatting set at higher levels of the control hierarchy is inherited by objects lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.HasAppearance
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether an object has been created.

remarks.p: Returns True when the Appearance object for the property has been created; otherwise, returns False.
Use this property to determine whether an object has been created. Appearance objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.Appearances
member.summary: Returns a collection of user-created Appearance objects.

remarks.p: The Appearance property of an object is used to associate the object with an Appearance object that will determine its appearance. The Appearance object has properties that control settings such as color, borders, font, transparency, etc. For many of the objects in UltraWinToolbars, you do not set formatting properties directly. Instead, you set the properties of an Appearance object, which controls the formatting of the object it is attached to.
This property is used to hold a collection of Appearance objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.EventManager
member.summary: The object that enables, disables and controls firing of specific component events.

remarks.p: The EventManager provides a high degree of control over how the control invokes event procedures. You can use it to selectively enable and disable event procedures depending on the context of your application. You can also use the event manager to return information about the state of the control's events.

The event manager's methods are used to determine the enabled state of an event (), to selectively enable or disable events (), and to determine whether an event procedure is currently being processed (). There is also an property that you can check to quickly determine whether any events have been disabled by the event manager.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.FloatingToolbarFadeDelay
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the period of inactivity, in milliseconds, before a floating fades.

remarks.p: This property indicates the period of inactivity before a floating UltraToolbar fades. When the mouse cursor is over a floating UltraToolbar, the toolbar is considered active.
The default value of this property is 0, meaning that no fading occurs.

member.summary: Returns or sets the ImageList control containing the small tool images associated with the control.

remarks.p: Tools can display large or small images, depending on whether they are on an or , controlled by the and properties, respectively. Use the ImageListSmall property to specify the ImageList that contains the tool images used when either of those properties is set to False.
Small tool images can be specified independently of an ImageList control during design-time customization, or by setting the property of the object on the tool's object.
The property indicates the ImageList control containing the large tool images.
The property is used to specify the size of the small tool images.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ImageTransparentColor
member.summary: Returns/sets the transparent color used when drawing tool images.

remarks.p: When set to a color other than Color.Transparent (the default), all occurrences of the color in the image will be made transparent.

If a tool image is supplied by setting an Appearance.Image property to an Imagelist index, the ImageLists TransparentColor property is looked at first. If the property is set to Color.TransparentColor, then the components ImageTransparentColor is used. If it is set to Color.TransparentColor, then no color masking is done.
If a tool image is supplied by setting the Appearance.Image property to an image, the components ImageTransparentColor is used. If it is set to Color.TransparentColor, then no color masking is done.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.LockToolbars
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether s are locked.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, UltraToolbars cannot be moved or made to float and grab handles are not displayed; otherwise, UltraToolbars can be moved, made to float, and grab handles are displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.MdiMergeable
member.summary: Returns/sets whether this will merge its tools and menus with another on an MDI parent or child form.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.MdiParentManager
member.summary: Returns or sets the for the MDI parent form or null for non-MDI applications or if the MDI parent form does not have an UltraToolbarsManager.

remarks.p: When MdiMergeable is true for the mdi parent form and the active mdi child, the toolbars are merged. The MdiParentManager of the mdi child's UltraToolbarsManager will return the UltraToolbarsManager of the mdi parent form. The ActiveMdiChildManager of the mdi parent will return the UltraToolbarsManager of the active mdi child form.

The MdiParentManager can be considering the UltraToolbarsManager which will display the merged toolbars. The ActiveMdiChildManager is the UltraToolbarsManager whose tools and toolbars have been merged with the toolbar manager that is displaying the merged toolbars. These properties are automatically set when used in a mdi parent/child situation but they may also be used to manually merge the tools and toolbars of two UltraToolbarsManager components.
In order to set the MdiParentManager or ActiveMdiChildManager, the property of both must be set to false or an exception will be generated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.MenuAnimationStyle
member.summary: Return or sets a value that specifies the animation style used to display s.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify how PopupMenuTools appear when they are displayed.

The animations are Unfold, where PopupMenuTools unfold from the upper-left corner to the lower-bottom; Slide, where they slide downward; Fade, where they fade in; Random, where an animation is selected at random; and None, where PopupMenuTools simply appear.

member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether font names are shown in their respective font in s.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, font names are rendered in their font in FontListTools; otherwise, font names are rendered in the control's font.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ShowFullMenusDelay
member.summary: Returns or sets a value the specifies the delay, in milliseconds, before a shows non-recently used tools when the mouse cursor hovers over the chevron indicator at the bottom of the PopupMenuTool.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is 500.
Tools that are used more frequently than others have their property set to True, while infrequently used tools have their RecentlyUsed property set to False.
The value of this property is ignored when the property is set to True, which means non-recently used tools are always shown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ShowMenuShadows
member.summary: Returns or sets an value that determines whether s are displayed with transparent shadows on their right and bottom edges.

remarks.p: When this property is set to Default, PopupMenuTools have shadows on their right and bottom edges when the property is set to OfficeXP, but do not have them when the Style property is set to Office2000. When this property is set to True or False, shadowing works independently of the Style property, with True specifying PopupMenuTools have shadows on their right and bottom edges and False indicating that they do not.
The property returns the resolved value of this property, taking into account the of the toolbars.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ShowMenuShadowsResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of , taking into account the value of the property.

remarks.p: When the ShowMenuShadows property is set to Default, s have shadows on their right and bottom edges when the property is set to OfficeXP, but do not have them when the Style property is set to Office2000.
This property returns True if PopupMenuTools have shadows; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ShowQuickCustomizeButton
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the Quick Customize button is shown on s.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, UltraToolbars display a Quick Customize button enabling users to customize; otherwise, the Quick Customize button is not displayed.
If this property is set to False, customization can still occur by right-clicking an UltraToolbar and selecting Customize... from the context menu that appears.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ShowShortcutsInToolTips
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the toolTips displayed for tools will contain the tool's assigned shortcut key combination.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, each tool's shortcut key combination appears in its toolTip; otherwise, the shortcut does not appear.
This value of this property is ignored when the property is set to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.ShowToolTips
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value determining whether toolTips are shown when the mouse cursor hovers over tools.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, the value of a tool's SharedProps.TooltipText property is displayed in a toolTip when the mouse cursor hovers over the tool; otherwise, the toolTip is not displayed.
The property specifies whether or not to display a tool's shortcut key combination in its toolTip.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.Style
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the style of all s, s, and tools.

remarks.p: The OfficeXP and Office2000 settings indicate that all toolbars, menus, and tools will function and appear like those used in OfficeXP or Office2000, respectively.
The property specifies the style of menu animation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinToolbars.UltraToolbarsManager.UseLargeImagesOnToolbar
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether tools on s use the and or and properties to render their images.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, tools utilize the ImageListLarge and ImageSizeLarge properties to draw their images; otherwise, the tools use the ImageListSmall and ImageSizeSmall properties instead.
The property specifies which properties tools use to render their images when they are on s.
The user can change the value of this property during customization.
